information_security_policy.title: Information Security Policy
information_security_policy.description: Foundational policy establishing the organization's commitment to information security

sections.title: 1. Purpose
sections.content: This Information Security Policy establishes [COMPANY_NAME]'s commitment to protecting information assets and defines the framework for information security management across the organization.

sections.title: 2. Scope
sections.content: This policy applies to all employees, contractors, vendors, and third parties who have access to [COMPANY_NAME] information systems and data.

sections.title: 3. Information Security Objectives
sections.content:
- Ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information assets
- Comply with applicable legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements
- Maintain customer trust through demonstrated security practices
- Enable business operations through secure information systems

sections.title: 4. Roles and Responsibilities
sections.content:
- Executive Management: Ultimate accountability for information security
- IT Security Team: Implementation and monitoring of security controls
- All Employees: Compliance with security policies and procedures

sections.title: 5. Policy Review
sections.content: This policy will be reviewed annually or following significant changes to the business or threat environment.

data_classification_policy.title: Data Classification Policy
data_classification_policy.description: Policy for classifying and handling different types of organizational data

sections.title: 1. Purpose
sections.content: This policy establishes a framework for classifying information assets based on their sensitivity and implementing appropriate protection measures.

sections.title: 2. Data Classification Levels
sections.content:
- PUBLIC: Information that can be freely shared
- INTERNAL: Information for internal use only
- CONFIDENTIAL: Sensitive information requiring special protection
- RESTRICTED: Highly sensitive information with limited access

sections.title: 3. Handling Requirements
sections.content: Each classification level has specific requirements for storage, transmission, access control, and disposal.

privacy_policy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy_policy.description: Public-facing policy describing data collection and processing practices

sections.title: 1. Information We Collect
sections.content: We collect personal information that you provide directly to us, information we collect automatically when you use our services, and information we receive from third parties.

sections.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
sections.content: We use your personal information to provide and improve our services, communicate with you, and comply with legal obligations.

sections.title: 3. Your Rights
sections.content: You have the right to access, correct, delete, or restrict processing of your personal information. You may also have the right to data portability and to object to processing.

sections.title: 4. Data Retention
sections.content: We retain personal information only as long as necessary for the purposes described in this policy or as required by law.

incident_response_procedure.title: Security Incident Response Procedure
incident_response_procedure.description: Step-by-step procedure for responding to security incidents

sections.title: 1. Incident Identification
sections.content:
- Monitor security alerts and reports
- Validate potential incidents
- Document initial findings

sections.title: 2. Incident Classification
sections.content:
- LOW: Minor incidents with limited impact
- MEDIUM: Incidents affecting business operations
- HIGH: Major incidents with significant impact
- CRITICAL: Incidents threatening business continuity

sections.title: 3. Response Actions
sections.content:
- Contain the incident
- Assess the scope and impact
- Implement remediation measures
- Document all actions taken

sections.title: 4. Communication
sections.content:
- Notify incident response team
- Inform affected stakeholders
- Report to regulatory authorities if required

sections.title: 5. Recovery and Lessons Learned
sections.content:
- Restore normal operations
- Conduct post-incident review
- Update procedures based on lessons learned

access_control_procedure.title: Access Control Management Procedure
access_control_procedure.description: Procedure for managing user access to information systems

sections.title: 1. Access Request Process
sections.content:
- Submit formal access request
- Manager approval required
- IT security review
- Access provisioning

sections.title: 2. Access Review
sections.content:
- Quarterly access reviews
- Manager certification
- Remove unnecessary access
- Document review results

sections.title: 3. Access Termination
sections.content:
- Immediate access removal upon termination
- Manager notification
- Return of access credentials
- Final access audit

risk_assessment_template.title: Information Security Risk Assessment
risk_assessment_template.description: Template for conducting information security risk assessments

sections.title: 1. Asset Identification
sections.content:
List all information assets including:
- Information systems
- Data repositories
- Network infrastructure
- Applications
- Personnel

sections.title: 2. Threat Assessment
sections.content:
Identify potential threats:
- Cybersecurity threats
- Physical threats
- Human error
- System failures
- Natural disasters

sections.title: 3. Vulnerability Analysis
sections.content:
Assess vulnerabilities:
- Technical vulnerabilities
- Procedural weaknesses
- Physical security gaps
- Human factors

sections.title: 4. Risk Calculation
sections.content:
Risk = Threat x Vulnerability x Impact
- Likelihood assessment
- Impact analysis
- Risk rating
- Risk prioritization

sections.title: 5. Risk Treatment
sections.content:
Risk treatment options:
- Accept the risk
- Mitigate the risk
- Transfer the risk
- Avoid the risk

privacy_impact_assessment.title: Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA)
privacy_impact_assessment.description: Template for assessing privacy impact of data processing activities

sections.title: 1. Processing Description
sections.content:
- Purpose of processing
- Types of personal data
- Categories of data subjects
- Recipients of data
- International transfers

sections.title: 2. Necessity and Proportionality
sections.content:
- Legal basis for processing
- Necessity assessment
- Proportionality analysis
- Less intrusive alternatives

sections.title: 3. Privacy Risk Assessment
sections.content:
- Risk to rights and freedoms
- Likelihood and severity
- Risk mitigation measures
- Residual risk evaluation

sections.title: 4. Consultation and Approval
sections.content:
- Stakeholder consultation
- DPO review
- Management approval
- Supervisory authority consultation (if required)
